sentences.english: Farming families with an only daughter are allowed to have a second, well-spaced birth.
sentences.chinese: 农村只有一个女孩的家庭在适当的时间允许生第二胎。

sentences.english: Couples who are both only children can also have a second child.
sentences.chinese: 如果夫妻俩都是独生子女，那么他们也可以生第二胎。

sentences.english: Thus, people argue that two-child policy should be put into effect.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人们开始推崇二胎政策。

sentences.english: I don't think I'll have a second child if the limit is removed.
sentences.chinese: 如果没有限制了，我想我也不会要二胎。

sentences.english: Wang said that the two-child policy will not lead to a population boom.
sentences.chinese: 二胎政策一旦放开会不会导致人口暴涨？

sentences.english: Child aborts every woman's second child.
sentences.chinese: 每个妇女的第二胎都打掉了。

sentences.english: Another reason, China wants to improve human rights by the universal two-child policy.
sentences.chinese: 另一个原因是中国希望通过全面二胎政策来改善人权。

sentences.english: Thus, people argue that two-child policy should be put into effect.
sentences.chinese: 因此，人们认为的二胎政策应该生效。

sentences.english: First of all two-child policy is the gift for some only child.
sentences.chinese: 首先，二胎政策对于一些独生子女来说是天赐的礼物。

sentences.english: In my opinion two-child policy should be carried out.
sentences.chinese: 在我看来，二胎政策是应该实施的。

sentences.english: Yicheng, it said, had been trying a two-child policy for 25 years.
sentences.chinese: 翼城县据说已经施行“二胎”政策25年了。

definition: to give birth without complications/easy childbirth/safe delivery/natural birth (without surgical operation)
expected date of childbirth/estimated due date (EDD)
marriage arranged following a pregnancy/marriage necessitated by an unplanned pregnancy
(of an expectant mother) to be in labor
a mom (mother of a young child)
abbr. for 產前檢查|产前检查[chan3 qian2 jian3 cha2]
to become pregnant/to carry a child in the womb
